line_1: But on high Grampia's fleecy top,
line_2: Where kids, the gelid herbage crop,

line_1: And rising Heaps improve the Mountain's Top,
line_2: Thus, when the Clouds their snowy Burden drop,

line_1: And turn their blossoms to the casement's top:
line_2: Projecting thatch the woodbine's branches stop,

line_1: And steeper be their Fall, as next the Top;
line_2: Whilst your high Brood must with the meanest drop,
As if they ne'er had toucht a Drop,

line_1: Beneath, beside me, and a top,
line_2: A hundred Sons! and not one Fop.

line_1: Few ever then got near its top:
Moist each Fibre, and each Top,

line_2: No more canst thou deceive my hope

line_1: So stooping down from hawthorn top,
line_2: He thought to put him in his crop;
And wild Arabia's plains you grope
That useful knowledge you may drop,

line_1: High Athos, Oete, and the Pin'y top
line_2: Of pleasant Ida into Cinders drop:

line_1: But when near the mountain top,
line_2: Down the beauteous pile would drop,
Must take his other Child, his Age's Hope
